Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
public class Date extends Object
This class represents calendar dates and provides certain manipulations of them.
Author:
Burhan Khan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Date(int requiredDay, int requiredMonth, int requiredYear)
    Constructs a date, If the day and/or month components are zero.
    Date(String dateString)
    Constructs a date, given a String holding the day/month/year representation of the date.

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date(int requiredDay, int requiredMonth, int requiredYear) throws Exception
      Constructs a date, If the day and/or month components are zero. or negative, they are treated as being 1; if they are too large, they are treated are being the largest value allowed.
      Parameters:
      requiredDay - The required day.
      requiredMonth - The required month.
      requiredYear - The required year.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the date components do not form a legal date since the start of 1753(post Gregorian Reformation).

    • Date

      public Date(String dateString) throws Exception
      Constructs a date, given a String holding the day/month/year representation of the date.
      Parameters:
      dateString - The required date as day/month/year.
      Throws:
      Exception - if dateString is not legal.

  • Method Details

    • setPresentDate

      public static void setPresentDate(Date requiredPresentDate) throws Exception
      Sets the present date. The date must not have already been set.
      Parameters:
      requiredPresentDate - The required date for the present day.
      Throws:
      Exception - if present date has already been set or if given data is null.

    • getPresentDate

      public static Date getPresentDate() throws Exception
      Gets the present date.
      Returns:
      The present date, or null if it has not been set.
      Throws:
      Exception - if present date has not been set.

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      Yields the day component of this date.
      Returns:
      The day

      public int getMonth()
      Yields the month component of this date.
      Returns:
      The month

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      Yields the year component of this date.
      Returns:
      The year

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides the day/month/year representation of this date.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A String day/month/year representation of this date.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date other) throws NullPointerException
      Compares this date with a given other one.
      Parameters:
      other - The other date to compare with.
      Returns:
      The value 0 if the other date represents the same date as this one; a value less than 0 if this date is less than the other; and a value greater than 0 if this date is greater than the other.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Date other) throws NullPointerException
      Compares this date with a given other one, for equality.
      Parameters:
      other - The other date to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if and only if they represent the same date.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null

    • lessThan

      public boolean lessThan(Date other) throws NullPointerException
      Compares this date with a given other one, for less than.
      Parameters:
      other - The other date to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if and only if this date is less than the other.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null

    • greaterThan

      public boolean greaterThan(Date other) throws NullPointerException
      Compares this date with a given other one, for greater than.
      Parameters:
      other - The other date to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if and only if this date is greater than the other.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null

    • addDay

      public Date addDay()
      Constructs a new date which is one day later than this one.
      Returns:
      A new date which is one day later than this one.

    • addMonth

      public Date addMonth()
      Constructs a new date which is one month later than this one. If the day is too large for that month, it is truncated to the number of days in that month.
      Returns:
      A new date which is one month later than this one.

    • addYear

      public Date addYear()
      Constructs a new date which is one year later than this one. If this date is a leap day, it returns 28th February of the next year.
      Returns:
      A new date which is one year later than this one.

    • subtractDay

      public Date subtractDay() throws Exception
      Construcs a new date which is one day earlier than this one. This can throw an exception. if the new date is earlier thatn the start of 1753
      Returns:
      A new date which is one day earlier than this one.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the new date is earlier than the start of 1753.

    • subtractMonth

      public Date subtractMonth() throws Exception
      Constructs a new date which is one month earlier than this one. This can throw an exception. if the new date is earlier thatn the start of 1753
      Returns:
      A new date which is one month earlier than this one.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the new date is earlier than the start of this month

    • subtractYear

      public Date subtractYear() throws Exception
      Constructs a new date which is one year earlier than this one. This can throw an exception. if the new date is earlier thatn the start of 1753 If this date is a leap day, it returns 28th Febrauary of the previous year.
      Returns:
      A new date which is one year earlier than this one.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the new date is earlier than the start of 1753.

    • daysFrom

      public int daysFrom(Date other) throws NullPointerException
      Calculates how many days this date is from a given other. If the other date is less than this one, then the distance is negative. It is non-negative otherwise (including zero if they represent the same date).
      Parameters:
      other - The other date.
      Returns:
      The distance in days.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null.
